events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection, resulting in damages to both cars and minor injuries.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the customer's car in a traffic collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and to facilitate communication throughout the process.
The claim acknowledgement was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps for resolving the auto accident case.
Requested detailed accident report, police report, photos of vehicle damage, and medical bills related to the injuries sustained.
Customer submitted all requested documentation including police and accident reports along with photos of the damaged vehicle for review.
The investigation team commenced examination of the submitted evidence to determine fault and verify the extent of damages from the collision.
Investigation concluded confirming customer was not at fault and assessed repair costs required to restore the vehicle after the accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover vehicle repairs, medical bills, and rental car expenses as per policy terms.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt response and transparency demonstrated throughout the claims process.
The claim was officially approved for payment after the customer accepted the proposed settlement agreement.
Payment was successfully issued covering vehicle repairs and associated medical expenses as part of the auto accident claim settlement.
The auto accident claim has been closed following payment issuance and confirmation from the customer that the repairs were completed satisfactorily.
All related documents and communications have been archived for record-keeping and future reference regarding the customer's auto accident claim.
